answers.text: International Telecommunication Union's radio telecommunications sector
an alliance of broadcasters, consumer electronics manufacturers and regulatory bodies

plausible_answers.text: an alliance of broadcasters, consumer electronics manufacturers and regulatory bodies

context: Since 1972, <a0_0><b5_0>International Telecommunication Union's<b5_0/> radio telecommunications sector<a0_0/> (ITU-R) had been working on creating a global recommendation for Analog HDTV. These recommendations, however, did not fit in the broadcasting bands which could reach home users. The standardization of MPEG-1 in 1993 also led to the acceptance of recommendations ITU-R BT.709. In anticipation of these standards the <a1_0>Digital Video Broadcasting<a1_0/> (DVB) organisation was formed, <a2_0><b6_0>an alliance of broadcasters, consumer electronics manufacturers and regulatory bodies<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The DVB <a3_0><b7_0>develops and agrees upon specifications<b7_0/><a3_0/> which are formally standardised by <a4_0><b8_0>ETSI<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
